channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for TX
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for TX

item.title: Report I-2024010055
item.description:
Report I-2024010055

Identified by scraper @ 2024-12-27T01:03:59+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-09
  • City: HOUSTON
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED AIRLINES
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Flight 854 returned to IAH due to customer in seat 9L laptop fell behind sidewall. The captain did not feel safe continuing with potential of lithium ion battery fire. The laptop was retrieved and given back to the passenger.

item.title: Report I-2024010023
item.description:
Report I-2024010023

Identified by scraper @ 2024-12-27T01:03:59+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-05
  • City: HOUSTON
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: PORT TERMINAL RAILROAD ASSOCIATION (INC)
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: At approximatly 1551 crew reported that the car was leaking from the manway when moved (Slosher) the car was immediately isolated and shipper was contacted. Shipper approved the use of PTRA contract Haz-Mat team to repair and remediate. Cause reported was loose manway bolts and no gasket., car was repaired, cleaned and released by Haz-Mat Special Services at 11 :21 AM on 01/06/24.

item.title: Report E-2024120329
item.description:
Report E-2024120329

Identified by scraper @ 2024-12-26T21:13:06+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-12-18
  • City: DALLAS
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On December 18, 2024, one (1) 5-gallon pail of paint was punctured and released approximately one (1) gallon of paint to the dock floor. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Lone Star Hazmat (LSH) to remediate the impacted site. The crew utilized granular absorbents and hand tools to remove all released paint. All impacted materials and the damaged pail were containerized in one (1) 55-gallon drum for disposal.

item.title: Report E-2024120312
item.description:
Report E-2024120312

Identified by scraper @ 2024-12-26T21:13:06+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-12-17
  • City: SANGER
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On December 17, 2024, one (1) 55-gallon drum of UN3149 was punctured by a nail and released approximately one (1) gallon of product to the trailer interior and pavement beneath. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Environmental Safety and Health Consulting Services (ES&H) to remediate the impacted site. The crew utilized absorbents and hand tools to remediate the site. The damaged drum was containerized in one (1) 95-gallon overpack and all impacted materials were containerized in one (1) 30-gallon drum for disposal.

item.title: Report X-2024121248
item.description:
Report X-2024121248

Identified by scraper @ 2024-12-26T21:13:06+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-12-14
  • City: FORT WORTH
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: Federal Express Corporation
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: The shipment was discovered leaking during sort operations. The Scrubbing Bubbles Toilet Bowl Cleaner Bubbly Bleach Gel and Scrubbing Bubbles Grime Fighter were leaking. 1 (leaking along the seam) plastic bottle of Scrubbing Bubbles Toilet Bowl Cleaner Bubbly Bleach Gel, 24 ounces (UN1760, Corrosive Liquid N.O.S. (Sodium Hydroxide, Sodium Hypochlorite), Class 8, PGII. 2 (leaking from the top x1) Scrubbing Bubbles Grime Fighter Citrusx567 grams (UN 1950 Aerosols Non-Flammable, Class 2.2, 1 can is empty x (567g each) 2 aluminum Bottles of perfume Chanel Allure Homme (100 ml ea.), UN3082 Environmentally Hazardous Substance Liquid 1 glass bottle Azzaro Wanted Perfume (50 ml) UN 3082 Environmentally Hazardous Substance Liquid 1 aluminum can of Gillette Shaving Cream x 56 g, UN1950 Aerosols Non-Flammable, Class 2.2 1 plastic bottle of Purell Hand Sanitizer x 24 ounces (no release (Ethyl Alcohol) 4 glass bottles of Emoni Nail Fungus Treatment x 24ml each; 1 bottle leaked approx. 10 ml (possibly DG) Other nonhazardous products in the package that did not leak: Opti Nail Fungus Treatment, Neutrogena Shower gel, Dayquil Cough Medicine, Sensodyne Toothpaste, Aveeno Lotion, Jergens Lotion, Everyman Jack shampoo and lotion, Kerasal Multipurpose Nail Repair & Fungal nail renewal, Perfect Ten Skin Tag Remover All contents were placed in a salvage drum and held for FAA investigation.

  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On December 13, 2024, sixteen (16) 1-gallon pails of paint were damaged and released approximately sixteen (16) gallons of paint to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from E3 Environmental (E3) to remediate the site. E3 personnel utilized absorbents and hand tools to containerize all waste in two (2) 55-gallon drums for disposal.

item.title: Report E-2024120376
item.description:
Report E-2024120376

Identified by scraper @ 2024-12-26T21:13:06+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-12-12
  • City: DICKINSON
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: RANGER LANDSTAR INC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On December 12, 2024, at 1127 ET, Emergency Response and Training Solutions (ERTS) was contacted by Landstar personnel in Dickinson, TX regarding the release of Spent Hydroprocessing Catalyst. Contractors were dispatched to the site to perform all onsite clean-up activities. Upon arrival, contractors confirmed the release of 100 pounds of Spent Hydroprocessing Catalyst (UN3190, 4.2, II) from (1) metal tote onto soil. The release was reportedly due to the flatbed trailer rolling on its side causing one of the caps to come off the tote, impacting a 10' x 5' area of soil. Contractors also found that 0.5 gallons of motor oil and 0.25 gallons of diesel fuel spilled from the truck while it was on its side, impacting soil. No drains or waterways were impacted by the release. A wrecker service removed the totes and up-righted the trailer. The impacted soil was scraped and collected, and the remainder of the spilled product was collected. Totes of remaining product were delivered to the consignee. All waste generated from addressing this release was containerized in (3) 55-gallon DM, which were taken to the consignee to be disposed of.

item.title: Report E-2024120317
item.description:
Report E-2024120317

Identified by scraper @ 2024-12-26T21:13:06+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-12-06
  • City: HOUSTON
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 12000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal LHO experienced a UN2582 Ferric Chloride Solution DWG Grade release from a 275-gallon poly tote. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup operations. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 30-gallons of product released to a 15 x 8 area of the trailer floor and a 40 x 40 area of the concrete lot below. The tote was punctured by metal sticking out on the trailer wall. The material was transferred from the damaged tote into a new one for shipment on. The impacted area was cleaned with absorbents. All impacted absorbents were then collected into (8) 55-gallon poly drums. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report I-2024120046
item.description:
Report I-2024120046

Identified by scraper @ 2024-12-26T21:13:06+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-12-04
  • City: Dallas
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: SOUTHWEST AIRLINES CO
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: During inbound cargo transfer, Cargo Agent was able to visually inspect if e-bike had the battery installed. Cargo Agent thought it might be installed based on limited visibility. After further inspection, it was confirmed that the battery was installed and not properly declared. Package was placed in quarentine until investigation was completed and shipper was notified. Shipment was n 1 terminated at the DAL Cargo facility.

item.description:
Report E-2024120365

Identified by scraper @ 2024-12-26T21:13:06+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-11-25
  • City: SAN ANTONIO
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: At 18:45 ET, XPO notified ERTS of a cargo release at terminal LSX. It was reported that approximately 1.25-gallons of Gulf PRO 2T 50:1 Fuel released from (2) 1-gallon plastic jugs due to a forklift puncture. The release impacted concrete dock floor. ERTS reviewed the SDS with the caller and determined that terminal personnel are capable of cleaning the release with PPE available on site.
